{{Citation style|date=October 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = Chaz Bundick |image = |caption = |alias = Toro y Moi |Born = 7 November 1986 (age 25) |origin = [[Columbia, South Carolina]] |genre = [[Electronic music|Electronic]], [[chillwave]], [[synthpop]], [[funk]] |occupation = [[Singer]]-[[songwriter]] |years_active = 2007âpresent |label = [[Carpark Records|Carpark]] |associated_acts = [[Les Sins]], [[Sides of Chaz]], [[The Heist and the Accomplice]] | background=solo_singer }}
'''Chazwick Bundick''' better known by his stage name '''Toro Y Moi''', is an American recording artist and producer. His music has taken on many forms since he began recording, but he is often identified with the [[chillwave]] movement of summer 2010. As of 2011, his sound has struck out toward progressive rock, especially in a live setting.
The name "Toro y Moi" can be roughly translated to "Bull and Me".
Bundick was born on 7 November 1986, in [[Columbia, South Carolina]], and attended Ridge View High School where he formed well-known Columbia [[indie rock]] band The Heist and the Accomplice with three schoolmates. He is of [[Filipino people|Filipino]] descent from his mother and [[African-American]] descent from his father.
Bundick graduated from the [[University of South Carolina]] in spring of 2009 with a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[graphic design]]. Late in his school career, Bundick formed a close musical relationship with fellow chillwave luminary Ernest Greene who plays under the name [[Washed Out]].
He has since been signed to [[Carpark Records]], on which he released his first full-length album ''[[Causers of This]]'' in January 2010.
His second album, ''[[Underneath the Pine]]'', was released on February 22, 2011. He has been chosen by [[Caribou (musician)|Caribou]] to perform at the [[All Tomorrow's Parties (music festival)|ATP Nightmare Before Christmas]] festival that they co-curate in December 2011 in Minehead, England.<ref>[http://www.atpfestival.com/events/nightmare2011.php ATP Nightmare Before Christmas]</ref> On September 13, Toro Y Moi released an EP titled ''Freaking Out''. The EP features a cover of "[[Saturday Love]]" by [[Alexander O'Neal]] & [[Cherrelle]].
==Discography== ===Studio albums=== *''[[Causers of This]]'' (January 2010) *''[[Underneath the Pine]]'' (February 2011)
===EPs=== *"Blessa" (7") (2009) *"Body Angles" (cassette, Ltd, C20) (2009) *"Left Alone at Night" (CD, promo + 12") (2009) *"Leave Everywhere" (digital, 7") (2010) *Toro y Moi / Cloud Nothings (Split 7") (2010) *"Freaking Out" (CD/vinyl) (2011)
===Demos=== *''Woodlands'' (Dec 2007) *''June 2009 Comp'' (Jun 2009) *''My Touch'' (Dec 2009)
===Remixes=== *The Longcut â "Repeated" (Toro Y Moi Remix) *Neon Indian â "Deadbeat Summer" (Toro Y Moi Remix) *Tegan and Sara â "Alligator" (Toro Y Moi Remix) *Washed Out â "Feel It All Around" (Toro Y Moi Remix) *Cut Copy â "Blink and You'll Miss a Revolution" (Toro Y Moi Remix) *[[Tyler, The Creator]] â [[French (song)#Toro y Moi Remix|"French!" (Toro Y Moi Remix)]]
===Other=== Contrary to popular belief, Sides of Chaz is not a Toro y Moi demo, but a collection of Bundick's experimental "stream of consciousness" recordings under his side project "Sides of Chaz". In addition to this, Chaz also feels as though he has moved beyond the "chillwave" genre, and that "chillwave" was a point where many similar artists started off. He said in an interview At The Sinema that "all that stuff is really good music, like Ernest Green (Washed Out) and Neon Indian. Iâm a big fan of all of that, but I think [chillwave] was just a small little period where we all were, coincidentally making the similar music." Chaz is also a multi-instrumentalist.
Chaz also has a side project focusing more on dance-style music called "Les Sins." ==References== <references /> *[http://carparkrecords.com/artists.htm Car Park Records] *[http://pitchfork.com/news/35870-news-in-brief-atmosphere-mt-st-helens-vietnam-band-toro-y-moi-jersey-live/ Pitchfork Media] *[http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2009/aug/13/new-band-toro-y-moi The Guardian] *[http://www.carparkrecords.com/ Car Park Records Album Announcement] *[http://pitchfork.com/news/40774-toro-y-moi-announces-sophomore-album/ Sophomore Album Announcement] *[http://www.self-titledmag.com/home/2010/02/09/a-quick-talk-with-toro-y-moi-about-freestyling-the-brilliance-of-blink-182-and-why-his-next-lp-will-be-even-more-lo-fi-than-this-one/ Self-Titled Mag Interview] *[http://atthesinema.co.uk/?p=3085/ At The Sinema Interview]
